title: Mawson Lakes Hotel: Man stabs patron in back during botched robbery
text:
A man has stabbed a hotel patron in the back during a botched robbery at Mawson Lakes.

The suspect escaped the area but a woman, the suspected getaway driver, was arrested after she crashed a stolen Mercedes-Benz, police say.

The incident unfolded when the man walked into the Mawson Lakes Hotel on Main St and threatened staff with a knife about 8.30pm on Saturday.

He tried to steal a cash but was disturbed and fled. Sometime during the incident the hotel patron was stabbed.

The victim was treated paramedics and taken to Royal Adelaide Hospital. His injuries are not believed to be life-threatening.

The suspect — described as being of Aboriginal appearance — was last seen running west on Main St.

A few minutes later, a stolen Mercedes-Benz sedan was found nearby on Metro Pde after it crashed into a gutter.

A woman ran from the scene and police suspect she was allegedly driving the car to be used in the robbery.

The 22-year-old Thevenard woman was arrested and charged with aggravated robbery and illegal use of a motor vehicle.

She did not apply for bail and will appear in the Elizabeth Magistrates Court on Monday.

Police say the car was stolen from Birkenhead on Tuesday night. It has been seized for forensic examination.

Officers and the police helicopter searched the area but could not find the man.

Northern CIB detectives and Serious Crime Task Force are investigating.

Anyone with information is asked to contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000 or online at crimestopperssa.com.au
description: A man is on the run after a hotel patron was stabbed in the back during a bungled pub robbery at Mawson Lakes. His alleged getaway driver was arrested after crashing her car.
